Commit.definition: to put into another's charge or trust
Commit.origin: [ committed her children to her sister's care]

1 a.definition: to put into another's charge or trust[her children to her sister's care]

sub_terms.b: to place in a prison or mental hospital esp. by judicial order [was found to be gravely disabled and was involuntarilyto the Central Louisiana State Hospital ", 531 So. 2d 575 (1988)"] compare,
sub_terms.c: to send (as a legislative bill) to a committee for consideration and report [ the crime bill to the joint committee]

1 a.committed: to the Central Louisiana State Hospital "

2.definition: to carry into action deliberately[to define and punish piracies and felonieson the high seas "art. I"]

3.definition: to obligate or bind oneself [would not to the irrevocable order]
